If you persist in this outdated, obsolete notion of personal freedom and individual rights, then you will have to suffer the consequences. The reason to ban assault rifles is simple: They have become the weapon of choice for mass shootings. They are being bought and diverted to drug cartels and criminal gangs in large quantities. Law enforcement agencies around the country have asked for this ban. The government of Mexico has asked for this ban. The usefulness of this weapon to citizens pales in comparison to its use by criminals and psychopaths.

Topic.Title: An Answer for ECHO !!

Message.Msg: Wow, talk about a rant that's all over the board! I'm surprised your head doesn't explode! I'll try to go paragraph by paragraph. 1st paragraph - #$%$. 2nd paragraph - I find you no professor either. 3,4 and 5 - Zimmerman had a right to be in the community, Martin didn't! What was he doing there? My father always told me "If you go looking for trouble, you might get hurt!" And that's what happened to Martin. Sad, but he's the consequence of his own actions. 6th paragraph - I haven't seen that yet. 7th and 8th paragraph - Yes it is. And you can't hunt with a 30 round magazine. There are restrictions on how many rounds you can have in a firearm when hunting for whatever type of game. It's in every Game and Fish manual. Read one! Going off on my own rant: Do you think our forefathers envisioned that the 1st amendment would also protect the Porn industry? Well it does! Larry Flynt (one of the most disgusting people on the planet) proved that! So yes It protects semi auto, full auto whatever. Show me where it doesn't! From Merriams dictonary: Infringe 1: to encroach in a way that that violates law or the rights of another. The last couple pararagraphs all I can say is, Crazy people do crazy stuff. Someone just killed what 300 people in a disco this weekend with Fire. It's just unexplainable what a deranged mind will think of and do.

Topic.Title: An Answer for ECHO !!

Message.Msg: Got a funny story about a guy I worked with who was a Marine. He was about 60. Alway's talked about the marines, being in the marines, a real jarhead, crewcut, alway's had some marine tie clip, etc, etc. Wasn't a day he didn't talk about the Marines. One day at lunch I asked him "So Leo, how long were you in the marines?" He said "2 years!" I about fell off my chair. I thought this guy was a lifer, maybe 25-30 years, retired! Unbelievable, he talked about it like it was yesterday.

Topic.Title: Well folks it's official, the second amendment has been deemed obsolete

Message.Msg: ... “I can't show you Obama's membership card to the Muslim Brotherhood. It would probably be fake anyway….if you still think that Obama's father was from Kenya…” – wilkes Oh, you can’t? I’m shocked! Oh, I get it. More birther nonsense from you losers. What a great strategy. You obviously learned nothing from the election. Perhaps you’ll show us something about the 450 million rounds of ammunition then…would that be okay? “However, his actions in supplying arms to the Brotherhood to overthrow Egypt, Libya, and Syria.” Really? So you were a big fan of Moammar Khadafi, Assad and Murabak, were you? Funny, their citizens seem to disagree with you, but, hey, your fellow citizens disagree with you here, also, and you could care less. “However, his actions in supplying arms to the Brotherhood to overthrow Egypt, Libya, and Syria makes me more than suspicious. The 450 million rounds of military ammunition that FEMA bought were undoubtedly siphoned off to the Brotherhood.” Oh, yes, the FEMA brown shirt emails and other conspiracy garbage. So, look here, wilkes. You nutballs have been here for some time now defending the NRA, as though they were the Gospel you follow. If I could show you what they have already said about your latest accusation about the 450 million rounds, would you kindly then #$%$ and go back under your rock, perhaps even, for once, admitting that you don’t know you’re a#s from your elbow – and that all you do is pass along silly, spammed, email #$%$ sent to gullible buffoons like you and jon? Okay, goofy, here you go, then: “DHS has indeed ordered hundreds of millions of rounds of ammunition. But there is less here than meets the eye. And that’s according to the National Rifle Association and the office of Republican Congressman Lynn Westmoreland of Georgia. The Department of Homeland Security recently contracted to buy up to 450 million rounds over the next five years. But DHS was making a first-time bulk order for all of its law enforcement agencies to save money. Those agencies include the Secret Service, the Transportation Security Administration and U.S. Customs and Border Enforcement, among many others. The NRA describes the assertion as ‘incendiary.’ It says the suggestion that the Obama administration is ‘preparing for a war with the American people’ displays ‘a lack of understanding of the law enforcement functions carried about by officers in small federal agencies.’ The NRA, which is no fan of the Democratic president, concludes that ‘there is no need to invent additional threats to our rights’.” That’s your beloved National Rifle Association calling your boorish behavior “incendiary” and telling you to shut up, grow up and man up. Is there anything else that you could do that would make you look any goofier? “Will 20 thumbs up on this post qualify me for the $100,000?” Well, no, but it WOULD go pretty far in convincing everyone that you’re simply a multi-aliased doofus with no life, who, incidentally, is not at all good as a cubicle message board troll. Debating ignorant folks like you is like shooting fish in a barrel – on full auto. So, all kidding aside - which charity gets your 10 bucks? Is that credit, debit or valuable ivory from jon’s stash? This board just gets wackier and wackier…

Message.Title: The last time T climbed to $40
Message.Msg: It started from about this level near the end of February 2008 and reached $40 about the middle of May. We seem to be starting at the end of January so can we expect $40 in April? April 40 Calls are selling for 2 cents and May 40s are 3 cents so it doesn't look like the market thinks $40 is very likely.

Topic.Title: Today's action.

Message.Msg: The only news I could find was "MONTREAL, Jan. 29, 2013 /PRNewswire via COMTEX/ -- Dorel Industries Inc., (CA:DII.B)(CA:DII.A), a Canadian-based world-class juvenile products and bicycle company, has selected AT&T* to connect more than 40 offices and integrate its worldwide operations and multiple divisions." That is just routine business for AT&T and could not cause a 2% rise in the stock price. I think it is programed trading resulting from the Stochastic turning up and the stock price moving above the 50 DMA. Many computer programs use these as buy triggers. There have been over a dozen trades in the 100,000 share range which indicates computers are involved.

Topic.Title: Today's action.

Message.Msg: Yeah, those 40 offices will REALLY add to the bottom line and explain today's movement. The rest of the stochastics and moving averages, Bollinger Bands, etc., etc, always have some bearing i suppose, but out of nowhere comes a big move. Not much to explain today's nice move. It's good for us investors who risk capital on the stock instead of playing the casino game that you seem to favor. Not meant disrespectfully, if that is your game Wilky. I just don't care to see gambling used to manipulate stock prices. You are small spuds in the contrivances of stock prices with futures anyway and I'm sure you get some kick out of your weekly contract betting. It's a nice hobby and beats Vegas odds as well with all your strategies. I just wish investing was done the old fashioned way. I put my money where my mouth is. I bought the actual stock and enjoy the decent dividend it gets. Fortunately, I don't need the div's and they are being used for other purposes and eventual inheritances. So if you single handedly screw things up with your weekly betting game, you mess up the future of my grandkids...
